page.title: 14A NATURE WALK POOLE HOSPITAL
page.content: We saw a lot of{cuckoo spit.}This is really a froth which contains the light green nymph of the frog-hopper. It is called cuckoo spit because it is seen in April and May as the cuckoo arrives. We found it on elderberry plants and bracken. We also saw some {red and black chequered beetles.}These were about 2cm long with 6 legs. There were lots of{blue dragonflies}and some red and black ones. The blue ones we later discovered are called Hawkers, so named because of their fast 'hawk like' flight. They are large and brightly coloured. The males are known to fight to defend their own stretch of water. Among the Hawkers you can find the Aeshna dragonfly. A fully grown Hawker has a wingspan of up to 10cm and a length of 7cm. Ours were 3cm long with a wingspan of 4cm.
